Description¶

Maya directed acyclic graph operations including modification and iteration of the graph.

Instanced Nodes¶

An instanced node has multiple parents but will always reference the same internal OpenMaya.MObject.

  • Children of instanced nodes are considered indirect instances.
  • A child can simultaneously exist as a direct and indirect instance.

An OpenMaya.MDagPath retrieved using an OpenMaya.MObject will always reference the zeroth indexed instance.

  • Index numbers are determined by position in the internal DAG hierarchy (see outliner).
  • Changing the order of instances will affect their OpenMaya.MDagPath.instanceNumber().

Parenting¶

When a direct instance is reparented with absolute positioning, a new intermediary transform is created between the parent and the instance.

  • It stores the offset between the old parent and the new parent so that other instances are not affected.
  • This is similiar to what happens when a shape node is reparented with absolute positioning to preserve component positions.

When an indirect instance is reparented, a new intermediary transform is created between the parent and each indirect instance.

  • Each indirect instance will now be directly instanced under its own intermediary transform.
  • Unless the new parent is the world, in which case a single intermediary transform will be created for the specific indirect instance. All other indirect instances are removed.

Intermediate Nodes¶

An intermediate node usually acts as a component cache for the original state of a deformable shape node.

  • They do not render in the viewport and are not visible in the outliner.
  • Any DAG node can be set as an intermediate but they are usually reserved for shapes and are usally suffixed with 'Orig'.

Note

  1. Functions for iterating ancestors by OpenMaya.MDagPath are not provided since ancestral iteration is non-instance specific. If paths to ancestors are required, the user can simply call OpenMaya.MDagPath.getAPathTo() or OpenMaya.MDagPath.getAllPathsTo() for each ancestral OpenMaya.MObject wrapper.

Note

  1. Functions for retrieving parents by name are not provided since multiple parents of an instance can have the same shortName.

Note

  1. Reindexing the name of a DAG node using 'transform#' will crosscheck against all existing nodes whose unindexed shortName begins with 'transform'. Meaning any DAG node, regardless of hierarchy or namespace can cause the index to increment.

Note

  1. Deleting instanced mesh nodes can sometimes cause shading issues due to the way Maya handles shader assignment. Maya controls the shading of instances by connecting instance specific plugs from a mesh to a shading group. When an instance is deleted these connections are not automatically updated. Rebuilding the scene should resolve these issues.

Warning

  1. Do not duplicate and reparent an indirect instance as a combined operation. Upon undoing this operation an uninteractable relic will be rendered in the viewport for any descendant shape node.

Warning

  1. Do not duplicate and reparent a shape node as a combined operation. The reparented shape will be unshaded as it will not be assigned to the source shading group.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.absoluteDuplicateTo(sourcePath, parentPath=None, renameShapes=True, **kwargs)¶

Duplicate a DAG node and parent it under a transform or the world whilst preserving its current world space transforms.

Mitigates the issues described by warning-1 and warning-2 so that even indirect instances and shapes can be used as sourcePath.

If sourcePath is an indirect instance, a single duplicate will be created for that specific indirect instance.

Note

  • If sourcePath is a transform, the duplicate’s local matrix will inherit the relative transform from the old parent to parentPath.
  • If sourcePath is a shape, the duplicate will be reparented under a new intermediary transform, inserted between parentPath and the shape.
Parameters:
  • sourcePath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a DAG node to duplicate and reparent.
  • parentPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath, optional) – Path to a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the duplicate. Renaming is completed via renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments corresponding to those from cmds.duplicate().
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parentPath is given but does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If sourcePath is a shape and parentPath is None.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MObject] – Wrappers of the duplicate nodes, including any descendants. The first element is always the root transform of the duplicate hierarchy. If upstreamNodes is True, any duplicate upstream nodes will be included. If returnRootsOnly is True, a single element list will be returned.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.absoluteReparent(childPath, parentPath=None, renameShapes=True)¶

Reparent a DAG node under a transform or the world whilst preserving its current world space transforms.

Note

  • If childPath is an uninstanced shape, it will be reparented under a new intermediary transform, inserted between parentPath and the shape.
  • If childPath is an uninstanced transform, its local matrix will inherit the relative transform from the old parent to parentPath.
  • If childPath is directly instanced, it will be reinstanced under a new intermediary transform, inserted between parentPath and the instance.
  • If childPath is indirectly instanced, other instances with the same parent will be parented under a new intermediary transform, inserted between parentPath and the instance.
Parameters:
  • childPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a DAG node to reparent.
  • parentPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath, optional) – Path to a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the new and old parents if childPath is a shape. Renaming is completed via renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parentPath is given but does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If childPath is a shape and parentPath is None.
  • RuntimeError – If childPath is already a child of parentPath.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MDagPath] – A path to the reparented node for the first instance of each new parent. If childPath is an indirect instance there will be multiple paths.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.absoluteUninstanceAllTo(instanced, parentPath=None, renameShapes=True, **kwargs)¶

Duplicate and reparent each instance of a DAG node to a transform or the world whilst preserving the current world space transforms of the instance, then remove the original instance from its current parent.

All direct and indirect instances of instanced will be uninstanced.

Note

  • If instanced is a transform, the local matrix of each duplicate will inherit the relative transform from the old parent to parentPath.
  • If instanced is a shape, each duplicate will be reparented under a new intermediary transform, inserted between parentPath and the shape.
Parameters:
  • instanced (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of an instanced DAG node.
  • parentPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath, optional) – Path to a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under each duplicate. Renaming is completed via renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments corresponding to those from cmds.duplicate(). Used to duplicate each instance of the instanced node. Note, this function only returns duplicate roots meaning the returnRootsOnly argument has no affect.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parentPath is given but does not reference a transform.
  • RuntimeError – If instanced does not reference an instanced node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If instanced is a shape and parentPath is None.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MObject] – Wrappers for the root transforms of each uninstanced duplicate hierarchy. One for each instance of the instanced node.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.absoluteUninstanceTo(instancePath, parentPath=None, renameShapes=True, **kwargs)¶

Duplicate and reparent a DAG node instance to a transform or the world whilst preserving its current world space transforms, then remove the original instance from its current parent.

If instancePath references an indirect instance, all related indirect instances will be uninstanced. Meaning any instance which shares the same instanced parent as instancePath will be duplicated to parentPath.

Note

  • If instancePath is a transform, the duplicate’s local matrix will inherit the relative transform from the old parent to parentPath.
  • If instancePath is a shape, the duplicate will be reparented under a new intermediary transform, inserted between parentPath and the shape.
Parameters:
  • instancePath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to an instanced DAG node.
  • parentPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath, optional) – Path to a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the duplicate. Renaming is completed via renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments corresponding to those from cmds.duplicate(). Used to duplicate instancePath. Note, this function only returns duplicate roots meaning the returnRootsOnly argument has no affect.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parentPath is given but does not reference a transform.
  • RuntimeError – If instancePath does not reference an instanced node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If instancePath is a shape and parentPath is None.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MObject] – Wrappers for the root transforms of each uninstanced duplicate hierarchy. Usually contains a single transform unless instancePath is indirectly instanced.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.createNode(nodeType='transform', parent=None)¶

Create a DAG node under a parent.

Parameters:
  • nodeType (basestring, optional) – Name of the node type identifier used to create a DAG node. Defaults to 'transform'.
  • parent (OpenMaya.MObject, optional) – Wrapper of a parent transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent is given but does not reference a transform.
  • ValueError – If nodeType is an invalid node type identifier.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper for the root of the new node hierarchy. If nodeType is a shape and parent is None, the new root node will be a transform.

Example

# This function is equivalent to the following Maya command
maya.cmds.createNode(nodeType, parent=parentPartialName)
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.deleteNode(node)¶

Delete a DAG node including all of its children.

Parameters:node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a DAG node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a DAG node.

Example

# This function is equivalent to the following Maya command
maya.cmds.delete(nodePartialName)
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.duplicate(sourcePath, renameShapes=True, **kwargs)¶

Duplicate a DAG hierarchy.

Parameters:
  • sourcePath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a DAG node. If the path references a shape, its parent transform will be duplicated.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the duplicate. Renaming is completed via renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments corresponding to those from cmds.duplicate().
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MObject] – Wrappers of the duplicate nodes, including any descendants. The first element is always the root transform of the duplicate hierarchy. If upstreamNodes is True, any duplicate upstream nodes will be included. If returnRootsOnly is True, a single element list will be returned.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.getChildByName(parent, childShortName)¶

Return a child of a transform.

Parameters:
  • parent (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a transform.
  • childShortName (basestring) – Short name of a child node parented under parent.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If parent does not have a child node with name childShortName.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper of the child node.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.getChildPathByName(parentPath, childShortName)¶

Return a path to a child of a transform.

Parameters:
  • parentPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a transform.
  • childShortName (basestring) – Short name of a child node parented under parentPath.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parentPath does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If parentPath does not have a child node with name childShortName.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MDagPath – Path to the child node.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.getParent(childPath)¶

Return the parent transform of a child node.

Parameters:childPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a child node.
Raises:RuntimeError – If childPath does not have a parent transform.
Returns:OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper of the parent transform.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.getParentPath(childPath)¶

Return a path to the parent transform of a child node.

Parameters:childPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a child node.
Raises:RuntimeError – If childPath does not have a parent transform.
Returns:OpenMaya.MDagPath – Path to the parent transform.

Example

# Returns an OpenMaya.MDagPath
getParentPath(childPath)
# Similiar to returning a path via the following Maya command
maya.cmds.listRelatives(childPartialName, parent=True, path=True)
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.hasIntermediateShapes(transform)¶
Parameters:transform (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a transform.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If transform does not reference a transform.
Returns:bool – True if transform has intermediate child shapes, False otherwise.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.hasShapes(transform)¶
Parameters:transform (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a transform.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If transform does not reference a transform.
Returns:bool – True if transform has child shapes, False otherwise.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.inspectVisibility(path)¶

Inspect the visibility of a DAG node.

The global visibility state of a node is given by OpenMaya.MDagPath.isVisible(). If any of the return values are False, path.isVisible() will also be False.

Parameters:path (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a DAG node.
Returns:(bool, bool, bool, bool) – A four-element tuple.
  1. Value of the 'visibility' attribute for the node referenced by path.
  2. Value of the 'lodVisibility' attribute for the node referenced by path.
  3. Visibility state of draw-overrides for the node referenced by path. If False, the 'overrideEnabled' attribute is on and the 'overrideVisibility' attribute is off.
  4. Visibility state for ancestors of path. If False, path is hidden because of an ancestor.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.instance(source, parent)¶

Instance a node under a transform.

Note

The source instance will always be added relative to parent since all instances must share the same transforms.

Parameters:
  • source (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a DAG node to instance.
  • parent (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a transform.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If source does not reference a DAG node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent does not reference a transform.
  • RuntimeError – If source is already a child of parent.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MDagPath – A path to source for the first instance of parent.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.isIndirectInstance(path)¶
Parameters:path (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a DAG node.
Returns:bool – True if path references an indirectly instanced node, False otherwise.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.iterAncestors(root, depthLimit=-1, breadth=False, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield ancestors of a root DAG node.

Note

By default the world OpenMaya.MObject will be yielded since it is the root ancestor of all children. The kWorld type constant can be used to exclude this ancestor if necessary.

Parameters:
  • root (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a DAG node.
  • depthLimit (int, optional) –

    Limit the depth of iteration up ancestral branches. Defaults to -1.

    • <0 : Full traversal of ancestors.
    • =0 : No traversal.
    • >0 : Traverse until the given depth.
  • breadth (bool, optional) – Whether to use breadth first traversal. Defaults to False. If True, exhaust an entire level of ancestors before proceeding to the next level. If False, exhaust an entire branch of ancestors before proceeding to the next closest branch using depth first traversal.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter ancestors based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kConstraint. Applicable values include kTransform, kConstraint. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If root does not reference a DAG node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of the ancestor nodes.

Example

# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers for ancestors of `root`
iterAncestors(root)
# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers for ancestors of `root`, excluding constraints
iterAncestors(root, filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kConstraint,))
# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers for ancestor transforms of `root`
iterAncestors(root, filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kWorld,))
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.iterChildren(parent, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield children parented under a transform.

Parameters:
  • parent (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a transform.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter children based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Applicable values include kTransform, kShape, kCamera, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent does not reference a transform.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of child nodes.

Example

# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers of transforms directly under `parent`
iterChildren(parent, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform,))
# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers of transforms directly under `parent`, excluding constraints
iterChildren(parent, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform, -OpenMaya.MFn.kConstraint))
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.iterChildrenByPath(parentPath, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield paths to children parented under a specific transform path.

Parameters:
  • parentPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a transform.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter children based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Applicable values include kTransform, kShape, kCamera, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parentPath does not reference a transform.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MDagPath – Paths to child nodes.

Example

# Yields OpenMaya.MDagPaths to transforms directly under `parentPath`
iterChildrenByPath(parentPath, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform,))
# Yields OpenMaya.MDagPaths to transforms directly under `parentPath`, excluding constraints
iterChildrenByPath(parentPath, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform, -OpenMaya.MFn.kConstraint))
# Called without filtering is similiar to returning paths via the following Maya command
maya.cmds.listRelatives(parentPartialName, children=True, path=True)
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.iterDescendants(root=None, depthLimit=-1, breadth=False, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield descendants of a transform.

Parameters:
  • root (OpenMaya.MObject, optional) – Wrapper of a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as root.
  • depthLimit (int, optional) –

    Limit the depth of iteration down descendant branches. Defaults to -1.

    • <0 : Full traversal of descendants.
    • =0 : No traversal.
    • >0 : Traverse until the given depth.
  • breadth (bool, optional) – Whether to use breadth first traversal. Defaults to False. If True, exhaust an entire level of descendants before proceeding to the next level. If False, exhaust an entire branch of descendants before proceeding to the next closest branch using depth first traversal.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter descendants based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Applicable values include kTransform, kShape, kCamera, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If root is given but does not reference a transform.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of descendant nodes.

Example

# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers for descendant transforms of `root`
iterDescendants(root, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform,))
# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers for descendant transforms of `root`, excluding constraints
iterDescendants(root, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform, -OpenMaya.MFn.kConstraint))
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.iterDescendantsByPath(rootPath=None, allPaths=False, depthLimit=-1, breadth=False, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield paths to descendants of a specific transform instance.

Parameters:
  • rootPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath, optional) – Path to a root transform. Defaults to None - world is used as root.
  • allPaths (bool) – Whether to yield a path for every instance in the descendant hierarchy of rootPath. If False, only yield a single path to instanced nodes in the descendant hierarchy of rootPath. Defaults to False.
  • depthLimit (int, optional) –

    Limit the depth of iteration down descendant branches. Defaults to -1.

    • <0 : Full traversal of descendants.
    • =0 : No traversal.
    • >0 : Traverse until the given depth.
  • breadth (bool, optional) – Whether to use breadth first traversal. Defaults to False. If True, exhaust an entire level of descendants before proceeding to the next level. If False, exhaust an entire branch of descendants before proceeding to the next closest branch using depth first traversal.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter descendants based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Applicable values include kTransform, kShape, kCamera, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If rootPath is given but does not reference a transform.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MDagPath – Paths to descendant nodes.

Example

# Yields OpenMaya.MDagPaths to descendant transforms of `rootPath`
iterDescendantsByPath(rootPath, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform,))
# Yields OpenMaya.MDagPaths to descendant transforms of `rootPath`, excluding constraints
iterDescendantsByPath(rootPath, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform, -OpenMaya.MFn.kConstraint))
# Called without filtering is similiar to returning paths via the following Maya command
maya.cmds.listRelatives(rootPartialName, allDescendants=True, path=True)
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.iterParents(child, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield parents of a child node.

Note

By default the world OpenMaya.MObject will be yielded if child is parented to the world. The kWorld type constant can be used to exclude this parent if necessary.

Parameters:
  • child (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a child node.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter parents based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kConstraint. Applicable values include kTransform, kConstraint. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If child does not reference a DAG node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of the parent nodes.

Example

# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers for parents of `child`
iterParents(child)
# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers for parents of `child`, excluding constraints
iterParents(child, filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kConstraint,))
# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers for parent transforms of `child`
iterParents(child, filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kWorld,))
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.iterRelatives(root, shapes=False, children=False, descendants=False, parents=False, ancestors=False, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield relatives of a DAG node.

Note

By default if parents is True, the world OpenMaya.MObject will be yielded if root is parented to the world. By default if ancestors is True, the world OpenMaya.MObject will be yielded since it is the root ancestor of all children. The kWorld type constant can be used to exclude this ancestor if necessary.

Parameters:
  • root (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a DAG node.
  • shapes (bool, optional) – Whether to yield child shapes. Defaults to False.
  • children (bool, optional) – Whether to yield all children. Overrides the shapes argument. Defaults to False.
  • descendants (bool, optional) – Whether to yield all descendants. Traversal will be depth first. Overrides the shapes and children arguments. Defaults to False.
  • parents (bool, optional) – Whether to yield parent transforms. If root is instanced, the parent of each instance will be yielded. Defaults to False.
  • ancestors (bool, optional) – Whether to yield ancestor transforms. If root is instanced, the ancestors of each instance will be yielded. Traversal will be depth first. Overrides the parents argument. Defaults to False.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter relative nodes based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh or kConstraint. Applicable values include kTransform, kShape, kCamera, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If either shapes, children or descendants is True and root does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If either parents or ancestors is True and root does not reference a DAG node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of the relative nodes.

Example

# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers for transforms directly under `root`
iterRelatives(root, children=True, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform,))
# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers for transforms directly under `root`, excluding constraints
iterRelatives(root, children=True, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform, -OpenMaya.MFn.kConstraint))
# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers for ancestor transforms of `root`
iterRelatives(root, ancestors=True, filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kWorld,))
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.iterRootTransforms(filterTypes=None)¶

Yield transforms parented directly under the world.

Parameters:filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter transforms based on OpenMaya.MDagPath compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude root transforms which have certain types of children. Applicable values include kCamera, kLight. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Yields:OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of the root transforms.

Example

# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers of root transforms which have child camera nodes
iterRootTransforms(filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kCamera,))
# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers of root transforms, excluding those which have child camera or light nodes
iterRootTransforms(filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kCamera, -OpenMaya.MFn.kLight))
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.iterSelectedNodesByPath(allPaths=False, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield paths to DAG nodes in the active selection. Non-DAG nodes will be ignored.

Parameters:
  • allPaths (bool) – Whether to yield a path for every selected instance of a node. If False, only yield a single path to the first selected instance of a node in the active selection. Defaults to False.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter paths to selected node based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh or kConstraint. Applicable values include kTransform, kShape, kCamera, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MDagPath – Paths to nodes in the active selection.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.iterShapes(parent, nonIntermediates=True, intermediates=True, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield shapes parented under a transform.

Note

At least one parameter must be True from the pair of filter options: nonIntermediates, intermediates.

Parameters:
  • parent (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a transform.
  • nonIntermediates (bool, optional) – Whether to yield non-intermediate shapes. Defaults to True.
  • intermediates (bool, optional) – Whether to yield intermediate shapes. Defaults to True.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter child shapes based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Applicable values include kCamera, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent does not reference a transform.
  • ValueError – If neither nonIntermediates nor intermediates is True.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of child shape nodes.

Example

# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers of mesh shapes directly under `parent`
iterShapes(parent, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kMesh,))
# Yields OpenMaya.MObject wrappers of non-mesh shapes directly under `parent`
iterShapes(parent, filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kMesh,))
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.iterShapesByPath(parentPath, nonIntermediates=True, intermediates=True, filterTypes=None)¶

Yield paths to shapes parented under a specific transform path.

Note

At least one of nonIntermediates or intermediates must be True.

Parameters:
  • parentPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a transform.
  • nonIntermediates (bool, optional) – Whether to yield non-intermediate shapes. Defaults to True.
  • intermediates (bool, optional) – Whether to yield intermediate shapes. Defaults to True.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter child shapes based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Applicable values include kCamera, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parentPath does not reference a transform.
  • ValueError – If neither nonIntermediates nor intermediates is True.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MDagPath – Paths to child shape nodes.

Example

# Yields OpenMaya.MDagPaths to mesh shapes directly under `parentPath`
iterShapesByPath(parentPath, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kMesh,))
# Yields OpenMaya.MDagPaths to non-mesh shapes directly under `parentPath`
iterShapesByPath(parentPath, filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kMesh,))
# Called without filtering is similiar to returning paths via the following Maya command
maya.cmds.listRelatives(parentPartialName, shapes=True, path=True)
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.relativeDuplicateTo(source, parent=None, renameShapes=True, **kwargs)¶

Duplicate a DAG node and parent it under a transform or the world whilst preserving its current local space transforms.

Mitigates the issues described by warning-1 and warning-2 so that even indirect instances and shapes can be used as source.

Parameters:
  • source (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a DAG node to duplicate and reparent.
  • parent (OpenMaya.MObject, optional) – Wrapper of a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the duplicate. If source is a shape, renaming will occur for all shapes under parent. Renaming is completed via renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments corresponding to those from cmds.duplicate().
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If source does not reference a DAG node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent is given but does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If source is a shape and parent is None.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MObject] – Wrappers for the duplicate nodes, including any descendants. The first element is always the root of the duplicate hierarchy. If upstreamNodes is True, any duplicate upstream nodes will be included. If returnRootsOnly is True, a single element list will be returned.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.relativeReparent(childPath, parent=None, renameShapes=True)¶

Reparent a DAG node under a transform or the world whilst preserving its current local space transforms.

Note

  • If childPath is uninstanced, it will be reparented directly under parent.
  • If childPath is instanced, it will be reinstanced directly under parent.
  • If childPath is indirectly instanced, other instances with the same parent will be reinstanced under their own intermediary transform, inserted between parent and the instance.
Parameters:
  • childPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a DAG node to reparent.
  • parent (OpenMaya.MObject, optional) – Wrapper of a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the new and old parents if childPath is a shape. Renaming is completed via renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent is given but does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If childPath is a shape and parent is None.
  • RuntimeError – If childPath is already a child of parent.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MDagPath] – A path to the reparented node for the first instance of each new parent. If childPath is an indirect instance there will be multiple paths.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.relativeUninstanceAllTo(instanced, parent=None, renameShapes=True, **kwargs)¶

Duplicate and reparent each instance of a DAG node to a transform or the world whilst preserving the current local space transforms of the instance, then remove the original instance from its current parent.

All direct and indirect instances of instanced will be uninstanced.

Parameters:
  • instanced (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of an instanced DAG node.
  • parent (OpenMaya.MObject, optional) – Wrapper of a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under each duplicate. Renaming is completed via renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments corresponding to those from cmds.duplicate(). Used to duplicate each instance of the instanced node. Note, this function only returns duplicate roots meaning the returnRootsOnly argument has no affect.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent is given but does not reference a transform.
  • RuntimeError – If instanced does not reference an instanced node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If instanced is a shape and parent is None.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MObject] – Wrappers for the root nodes of each uninstanced duplicate hierarchy. One for each instance of the instanced node.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.relativeUninstanceTo(instancePath, parent=None, renameShapes=True, **kwargs)¶

Duplicate and reparent a DAG node instance to a transform or the world whilst preserving its current local space transforms, then remove the original instance from its current parent.

If instancePath references an indirect instance, all related indirect instances will be uninstanced. Meaning any instance which shares the same instanced parent as instancePath will be duplicated to parent.

Parameters:
  • instancePath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to an instanced DAG node.
  • parent (OpenMaya.MObject, optional) – Wrapper of a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the duplicate. If instancePath is a shape, renaming will occur for all shapes under parent. Renaming is completed via renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments corresponding to those from cmds.duplicate(). Used to duplicate instancePath. Note, this function only returns duplicate roots meaning the returnRootsOnly argument has no affect.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent is given but does not reference a transform.
  • RuntimeError – If instancePath does not reference an instanced node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If instancePath is a shape and parent is None.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MObject] – Wrappers for the root nodes of each uninstanced duplicate hierarchy. Usually contains a single node unless instancePath is indirectly instances.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.removeNode(path)¶

Remove a DAG node from one of its parents.

Parameters:path (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a DAG node. The node will be removed from the parent given by node.pop().

Example

# This function is equivalent to the following Maya command
maya.cmds.parent(nodePartialName, removeObject=True)
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.removeOtherInstances(instancePath)¶

Removes all other instances of the node referenced by the given path.

Note

If instancePath references an indirect instance, it will remain indirectly instanced under its current parent.

Parameters:instancePath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to an instanced DAG node.
Raises:RuntimeError – If instancePath does not reference an instanced node.
msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.renameShapes(parent)¶

Rename all child shape nodes under a parent transform.

Names for non-instanced shapes will follow the format '<parentShortName>_shape<##>'.

Names for instanced shapes will follow the format '<parentShortName>_instance_shape<##>'.

  • '<parentShortName>' will correspond to the parent of the zeroth indexed shape instance.
  • The addition of the 'instance' token aims to prevent confusion for instances whose parent does not correspond to '<parentShortName>'.

A recursive call will be made for the parents of every instanced shape in order to avoid name clashes with their own child shapes.

Parameters:parent (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a parent transform.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent does not reference a transform.
